title: Georgia House - Day 34 (2026-06-19)
summary:
Overview:
The Georgia House session on June 19, 2026 focused on logistical and procedural matters, as the Senate had not agreed to the House's proposed adjournment resolution. This resulted in the House needing to remain in session the following day, which was Father's Day.

Key Actions:
None detected.

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
None detected.

Notable Moments:
- The House Speaker announced that the Senate had not agreed to the House's adjournment resolution, meaning the House would need to remain in session the following day, which happened to be Father's Day.
- The Speaker encouraged committees to meet over the next hour, as the Clerk's office would need time to prepare for a supplemental rules calendar at 4:30 PM.
- A rules committee meeting was scheduled for 3:45 PM in room 341.

Votes:
None detected.

Attendance:
No specific quorum notes.

Adjournment:
The House went into recess until 4:30 PM, when they would take up a supplemental rules calendar. The next session date was not provided.

House will come back to order.
will come to order here for momentarily. I understand we have the sound issues fixed
with room 341. Of course, if a tree falls in a room with no one in it, maybe you guess
you can't hear it. Okay. I have a couple of announcements for you. A couple of
announcements. First of all, the Senate has not agreed to our adjournment resolution.
They are, they have set a rules calendar for-
Just so y'all will know, there will be a rules meeting at 345.
That was the other one. Obviously we don't have the sound problem fixed for 341.
So as of right this minute, we will be in session tomorrow, subject to a motion by the majority
leader as to time, and I'm well aware that it's Sunday's Father's Day, and you know,
that was one of the reasons that somebody in the Senate said three or four weeks ago
So we couldn't come in at a time we recommended because we had to enjoy Father's Day.
So I guess whether we enjoyed or not now has it been determined.
So right now plan to be here tomorrow and help us get the word out.
Secondly there will be a rules committee meeting in room 341 at 345 and then the clerk's
office, we'll need some time to assemble the work that whatever they prepare.
Okay, I'm advised that there were committees that had scheduled meetings this afternoon.
Clerk's office is going to need about 30 minutes at least to get things ready.
So I'm going to encourage any committees that want to meet, need to meet, to meet now
over the next hour and use this time wisely and then we will be at ease, it will be in
